result.execSummary:
The defendant Mallory Lou Scharine was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).
  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Def to report to the DOC in Ashland within 24 hours!
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.
  While on supervision the Def is to pay their financial obligations thru the Clerk of Court, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges, etc that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Ashland Co Clerk of Circuit Court
201 Main Street West - Room 307
Ashland, WI  54806

miscConds.notes: The Def is to obtain counseling as directed by DOC at the expense of the Def.

Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are present, consumed or sold..
  The Def is subject to random UA testing.  
The Def is to provide a DNA specimen and confirmation of sample within 7 days at LE agency in Wisconsin. 
The Def is to provide a DNA specimen with in 7  days to the Ashland County Jail and confirmation of sample within 7 days at LE agency in Wisconsin. 
  Upon successful completion of the terms/conditions of this sentence (including payment of all financial obligations) and supervision followed with a letter confirming successful completion from DOC, this record would be expunged!
Any contraband seized is ordered forfeited. 
  Upon successful completion of the terms/conditions of this sentence (including payment of all financial obligations) and supervision followed with a letter confirming successful completion from DOC, this record would be expunged!
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment within 45 days of probation and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Mallory Lou Scharine not in court. Prosecuting Atty Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for State of Wisconsin. Ct will take civil judgment on any outstanding financial obligations owed to Ashland County

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Allowing Travel outside the Continental United States:  Mexico

Defendant Mallory Lou Scharine in court with by phone with  attorney M. Joseph Rafferty in court.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Def comments doing well on probation, no PO holds, random drug testing set up, Request to let def go on family vacation in Mexcio. DOC can provide interstate travel but not out of country. DOC told Atty if CT allows def to go will let her. DA has no comment. Ct comments finding nothing contray to her rehibliation CT permits def to travel to Mexico with family in Jan as set forth in letter from atty.
of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Mallory Lou Scharine appeared by phone means. Prosecuting Atty Kelly J Mcknight appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney M. Joseph Rafferty in court for Defendant Mallory Lou Scharine. Def pleads No Contest to counts 4 & 5, Counts 6 & 7 Dismissed - read in. All contraband seized is forfeited. Withheld sentence and 12 months of probation with following conditions: Undergo  AODA assessment w/in 45 days of probation and comply with all treatment rec., Complete any counseling as recommended by DOC, Pay $10.00 fine plus court cost of 498.80 on each count plus $33.00 service fees. Contact DOC today! ok to contact by phone, Provide DNA sample and confirmation of sample w/in 7 days at LE agency in Wisconsin, 60 days to post full payment, Youthful expungement if probation followed and no new crimes,     Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are present, consumed or sold..

Attorney M. Joseph Rafferty in court.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Auth filed. Status has changed. Atty would like to talk to def to see if there is an agreement.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2016 at 09:00 am.
